name: Ping device
info:
Pings a device once when `msg` is recievied. 
It outputs only when status changes.
After a specified amount of attempts, it considers the device as disconnected.


A recurring inject as input is recommended.

It use enviroment flow variables to keep track of the failed attempts.
If there is any need to reset them send a `msg.reset`.

## inputs
`msg.ip` the Ip to ping

## enviroment variables
`Ping attempts` how may failed ping for a device to be considered down.

`Ping timeout` maximum time allowed for a single ping response.

name: ping query
func:
msg.query = "ping -c 1 -w " + env.get("max_response_time") + " "  + msg.ip +" >/dev/null && echo 'up' ||  echo 'down'"
return msg;

name: count failed pings
threshold trigger
see all flow variables
func:
msg.payload = flow.keys()
return msg;

name: status changed
func: rbe

name: build json response
build query
func:
msg.offset_in_ms = msg.payload.days_offset * 86_400_000

let newFrom = new Date(msg.time_from - msg.offset_in_ms).toISOString()
let newTo = new Date(msg.time_to - msg.offset_in_ms).toISOString()

msg.query =
    "SELECT " + msg.payload.SELECT +
    " FROM " + msg.payload.FROM +
    " WHERE " + msg.payload.WHERE.join(" AND ") +
    " AND time > '" + newFrom + "' AND time < '" + newTo + "'" +
    " GROUP BY " + msg.payload.GROUP_BY
return msg

name: convert days_offset to json
flatten Json
checks zoomThreshold
func:
let zoomThreshold = msg.payload.days_zoom_threshold * 86_400_000 // we dont want to show old data when zoomed out


msg.field_name_prefix = msg.payload.field_name_prefix

//convert from string to number
msg.time_to = Number(msg.payload.time_to)
msg.time_from = Number(msg.payload.time_from)

if (msg.time_to - msg.time_from > zoomThreshold) return [null , msg]
else return [msg , null]

name: ping query

query:
from(bucket: "devices")
  |> range(start: -inf)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "devices_info")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "device_name")
  |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")

return msg

name: ping query
func:
let timeout = "1" //seconds
msg.ip = msg.payload.ip_address
msg.query = "ping -c 1 -W " + timeout + " " + msg.ip + " &> /dev/null && echo \"up\" || echo \"down\""
return msg;

name: delete from devices_info
func:
let bucket = "devices";
let org = "bubli";
let measurement = "devices_info"
let start = "1970-01-01T00:00:00Z"; // From the beginning of time
let stop = new Date().toISOString();  // To Current timestamp
let mac_address = msg.mac_address

// Generate the full query string
msg.payload = `influx delete \\
  --bucket ${bucket} \\
  --org ${org} \\
  --start "${start}" \\
  --stop "${stop}" \\
  --predicate '_measurement="${measurement}" AND mac_address = "${mac_address}" '`;



return msg

How to add fertilizer
info:
To add fertilizer copy this block of code and 
- change the name of link in to the fertilizer name
- add fertilizer in "set fertilizer list" after "on first load"
- change position number in function block. it only affets the position in which is displayed in grafana annotation
- update the dashboard. add a 5x2 group with the fertilizer widget inside. you can also order the display order in node red dashboard here

do not use spaces in the fertilizer name, use _ instead. for example "bio_grow" will become "BIO GROW"
